titleStmt.title: Moravian Lives Personography
titleStmt.principal:
Katherine Mary Faull, Principal Investigator Bucknell University
Lewisburg, Pennsylvania
faull@bucknell.edu

Christer Ahlberger, Principal Investigator, 2015-2018 University of Gothenburg
Gothenburg, Sweden
christer.ahlberger@history.gu.se

sourceDesc.p: List of Moravian Lives person entities with reference to persistent identifiers, using ML standard names

revisionDesc.change: Updated responsibility list, added more names and fields

person.note: (LW/G/F)CBssALLOT, Mary (1734-1754) b 12.08.1734 Rastrick Parish of Halifax reception: baptized Church of England, received society/sisters’ house Cleckheaton May 1746, sisters’ house Tyersal 1750, received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 25.03.1751 (OS) / 05.04.1751 (NS), new sisters’ house Fulneck 15.12.1752, sacrament Yorkshire in Fulneck 25.02.1753 d 25.12.1754 aged 20 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br G Traneker 28.12.1754 grave 75 - 1st section, 2nd row, 8th grave from path

event.desc:
St Peter's Church Hartshead 11 August, 1740
22 August, 1740

person.note: (W/F/G)ASHLEY, Hannah (1740-1761) b 09.08.1740 (OS) / 20.08.1740 (NS) Hartshead educated: girls’ school Row Head 1748 resided: Hartshead 1740-1758 reception: baptized St Peter’s Church Hartshead 11.08.1740 (OS) / 22.08.1740 (NS), received society Mirfield 1752, received congregation Fulneck 13.11.1756, sisters’ house Gomersal 01.07.1758, sisters’ house Fulneck 02.02.1759, sacrament Fulneck 28.11.1759 family: daughter of John Ashley (b 1712) and Martha (née Keighley) (b 1711), sister of Mary (Southwell) (b 1734), Martha (b 1737), Joshua (b 1744), Sarah (b 1745), Betty (b 1747) and Benigna (b 1749) d 05.05.1761 aged 20, interred Fulneck by Br B La Trobe 07.05.1761 grave 188 - 1st section, 6th row, 3rd grave from path

relation.name: sister
relation.desc: Mary, Martha, Joshua, Sarah, Betty, and Benigna

person.note: (LW/W/P/F)=#BENTLEY, Abigail (1722-1766) b 23.09.1722 Wyke Parish of Birstall reception: baptized Church of England, Ingham’s society Wyke, received society Norwood Green 1742, transferred society Mirfield 1748, transferred society Holme 1752, received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 13.11.1752, new sisters’ house Fulneck 15.12.1752, sacrament Yorkshire in Fulneck 27.01.1754, founder member Fulneck congregation 19.04.1755 d 07.12.1766 aged 44 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br B La Trobe 10.12.1766 grave 307 - 1st section, 11th row, 7th grave from path

(W/F)BOOTH, Elizabeth (Betty) (1735-1764) b 11.09.1735 Mirfield educated: girls’ school Row Head 1748 reception: baptized St Mary’s Church Mirfield 14.09.1735 (OS) / 25.09.1735 (NS), received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 13.11.1752, sisters’ house Fulneck 30.12.1752, sacrament Yorkshire in Fulneck 09.09.1753, founder member Fulneck congregation 19.04.1755, congregation office: intercessor Fulneck family: daughter of Thomas Booth (b 1708) and Mary (née Hoykard) (b 1706), granddaughter of David Booth, sister of Joseph (b 1730, Martha (b 1738) and Matthew (b 1741), sister-in-law of Mary (née Robinson) (b 1730) d 21.04.1764 aged 28 Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br J Charlesworth 24.04.1764 grave 265 - 1st section, 9th row, 7th grave from path

(W/G/F)£^BRADLEY, Rachel (1742-1809) b 04.10.1742 (OS) / 15.10.1742 (NS) Golcar Parish of Huddersfield occupation: sewer resided: Golcar 1735 - 1758 reception: baptized Church of England, sisters’ house Gomersal 21.05.1758, sisters’ house Fulneck 11.11.1758, received congregation Fulneck 13.11.1759, sacrament Fulneck 13.08.1767, returned sisters’ house Gomersal 1784 not on Gomersal catalogue 1789 family: daughter of Benjamin Bradley (b 1700) and Mary (née Walker) (b 1708), granddaughter of Robert Bradley, and Thomas Walker, sister of Richard (b 1732), Henry (b 1733), Job (b 1735), Elizabeth (b 1737), Benjamin (b 1739), John (b 1741), William (b 1745), Mary (b 1747), Grace (b 1749) and John (b 1753), sister-in-law of Susanna (née Lee) (b 1736), aunt of John (b 1757), Richard (b 1760) and Elizabeth Bradley (b 1762) d 30.08.1809 aged 66 Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br S T Benade 02.09.1809 grave 1242 - 1st section, 53rd row, 2nd grave from path

(G/F)x+^BROOK, Rachel (1744-1815) b 28.04.1744 Birstall occupation: sewer resided: Birstall 1744-1760 reception: baptized St Peter’s Church Birstall 13.05.1744 (OS) / 24.05.1744 (NS), received society Gomersal 30.08.1758, sisters’ house Fulneck 04.10.1760, received congregation Fulneck 11.05.1761, sacrament Fulneck 08.05.1762 family: daughter of John Brook (b 1709) and Alice (née Lord) (b 1712), granddaughter of William Brook and Hannah (née Birtby) (b 1687), and Samuel Lord, niece of Samuel Brook (b 1713) and Hannah (Brook, née Lord) (b 1708), sister of John (b 1740), Hannah (b 1742), Sarah (b 1748), Elizabeth (b 1750), Anna (b 1752), Samuel (b 1754) and Joshua (b 1756) d 16.11.1815 aged 71, interred Fulneck by Br C F Ramftler 20.11.1815 grave 1321 - 1st section, 57th row, 4th grave from path

(D/P/F)CBssBROWN, Elizabeth (Betty) (1721-1779) b 24.02.1720 (OS) / 07.03.1721 (NS) Newton Parish of Manchester resided: Newton 1721, Ashton-under-Lyne 1730, Dukinfield 1735 reception: baptized Church of England, David Taylor’s society Dukinfield, Moravian society Dukinfield January 1744, received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 08.06.1746 (OS) / 19.06.1746 (NS), sacrament Yorkshire in Fulneck 06.09.1747 (OS) / 17.09.1747 (NS), sisters’ house Holme 1748, Grace Hall Fulneck 09.10.1750, sisters’ house Fulneck 15.12.1752, sisters’ house Dukinfield 06.10.1753 family: daughter of Francis Brown and Alice (née Whitaker), sister of Mary (b 1719), John (b 1723), Alice (b 1730), James (b 1735) and Hannah (b 1738) d 14.06.1779 aged 58, interred Dukinfield grave 85

(P/F)+^CALVERT, Martha (1743-1816) b 19.10.1743 Idle Parish of Calverley occupation: spinner reception: baptized St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley 06.11.1743 (OS) / 17.11.1743 (NS), received society Pudsey 1758, sisters’ house Fulneck 21.05.1759, received congregation Fulneck 13.11.1759, sacrament Fulneck 29.08.1761 family: daughter of Samuel Calvert (cordwainer of Idle) d 15.03.1816 aged 72, interred Fulneck by Br C F Ramftler 18.03.1816 grave 1327 - 1st section, 58th row, 3rd grave from path

event.desc: 16 January, 1746 27 January, 1747 left London for Germany
recieved as acoluth and blessed as deaconessAnnehof Holland

person.note: (P/F/G)CENNICK Sarah (Sally) (1712-1770) b 12.06.1712 (OS) / 23.06.1712 (NS) Reading resided: London 1729, returned Reading 1733, Kingswood 1741, East Tytherton 1744-1747 reception: baptized Church of England, received society Fetter Lane May 1739, left London for Germany 16.01.1746 (OS) / 27.01.1747 (NS), sisters’ house Herrnhaag 1747, received congregation Herrnhaag 1747, confirmed Herrnhaag 1747, sacrament Herrnhaag January 1748, sisters’ house Pudsey May 1748, Disciple’s House London July 1750-1751, Annenhof Holland January 1759, Herrnhut 12.08.1759, returned England 13.10.1760 congregation office: intercessor Herrnhaag 1748, congregation servant Yorkshire 1748 church orders: received as acoluth and blessed as deaconess Annenhof Holland 24.05.1759 church service: single sisters’ choir servant and choir helper Yorkshire 1748 - July 1750, single sisters’ labourer Dublin 1751, single sisters’ labourer North of Ireland 1752-1759, single sisters’ labour Bedford 13.10.1760, Lampeter c 1762, assistant labourer among single sisters and great girls of country congregations based Gomersal 16.01.1765 retired sisters’ house Fulneck 20.11.1769 family: daughter of George Cennick and Anna, sister of John (b 1718) and Anna (Stone), sister-in-law of Jane (née Bryant, later Moore) (b 1721) and ? Stone, aunt of John Cennick Stone (b 1743), and Sarah (b 1749), Ann Grove Cennick (b 1751) and Elizabeth Hannah (Swertner) (b 1752) d 24.01.1770 aged 57 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br J Charlesworth 29.01.1770 grave 390 - 1st section, 16th row, 4th grave from path resited gravestone - right hand side of path to terrace, 4th stone from gate

(P/F/D)ssCLAGGETT, Elizabeth (Betty) (1715-1767) b 20.12.1715 (OS) / 31.12.1715 (NS) Castleford Yorkshire resided: Castleford 1715, London 1720, Castleford 1730, London 1734 - June 1742, October 1742 - July 1743, Fulneck settlement 29.09.1750 - 27.02.1753 reception: baptized All Saints’ Church Castleford 11.01.1715 (OS) / 22.01.1716 (NS), confirmed All Saints’ Church Castleford 1732, received society Fetter Lane 1740, received congregation London 25.12.1742 (OS) / 05.01.1743 (NS), sacrament London 05.02.1742 (OS) / 16.02.1743 (NS), left London for Yorkshire 24.06.1743 (OS) / 05.07.1743 (NS), sisters’ house Pudsey 24.07.1743 (OS) / 04.08.1743 (NS), sisters’ house Littlemoor 21.06.1748 (OS)/02.07.1748 (NS) - 03.05.1749 (OS)/14.05.1749 (NS), sisters’ house Fulneck 27.02.1753 church service: co-helper with single sisters Yorkshire 02.07.1743 (OS) / 13.07.1743 (NS), single sisters’ warden Yorkshire 16.08.1744 (OS) / 27.08.1744 (NS), single sisters’ labourer Yorkshire 05.10.1744 (OS) / 16.10.1744 (NS), resigned due to ill-health June 1748, single sisters’ warden Dukinfield 04.05.1749 (OS) / 15.05.1749 (NS) - 29.09.1750 family; daughter of Wiseman Claggett and Martha (née Clifton) (b 1691), sister of Susanna (b 1723), John Clifton (b 1725), Martha (b 1726), Ann (Shepley) (b 1728) and Catherine (b 1730), sister-in-law of Daniel Shepley (b 1721), aunt of John Benjamin (b 1767) and Anna Shepley (b 1770) d 12.08.1767 aged 51 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br B La Trobe 14.08.1767 grave 324 - 1st section, 12th row, 6th grave from path

event.desc: 25 December, 1743 5 January, 1744 recieved congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck

person.note: (P)CBssox+^>=#CLARK, Elizabeth (Betty) (1717-1768) b 07.05.1717 (OS) / 18.05.1717 Holbeck Parish of Leeds reception: baptized Presbyterian Church, Ingham’s society Holbeck, received society Holbeck 1742, received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 25.12.1743 (OS) / 05.01.1744 (NS), sacrament Yorkshire in Fulneck 20.07.1744 (OS) / 31.07.1744 (NS), sisters’ house Pudsey 1753, founder member Pudsey congregation 18.04.1755, returned society Holbeck August 1758 d 22.06.1768 aged 51 Pudsey, interred Fulneck by Br B La Trobe 25.06.1768 grave 354 - 1st section, 14th row, 2nd grave from path

(LW/P/F)CBss=#CLARK, Elizabeth (Betty) (1725-1785) b 31.07.1725 (OS) / 11.08.1725 (NS) Northowram Parish of Halifax reception: baptized Presbyterian Church, Ingham’s society Shelf, received society Shelf 1744, transferred society Smith House 1745, sisters’ house Oxheys February 1745, received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 14.04.1745 (OS) / 25.04.1745 (NS), sacrament Yorkshire in Fulneck 18.08.1745 (OS) / 29.08.1745 (NS), sisters’ house Holme 1747, Pudsey 1752, sisters’ house Fulneck March 1753, founder member Fulneck congregation 19.04.1755, transferred congregation Pudsey 14.03.1775 church orders: received as acoluth Fulneck 14.08.1766 church service: single sisters’ labourer Littlemoor 14.03.1775 d 17.01.1785 aged 59 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br G Traneker 21.01.1785 grave 731 - 1st section, 43rd row, 1st grave by path

(G/P/F)CBssCLARK, Hannah (1726-1756) b 29.12.1726 Northowram Parish of Halifax reception: baptized Northowram and Coley non-conformist (Presbyterian) Church 03.02.1726 (OS) / 14.02.1727 (NS), received society Little Gomersal 1748, received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 01.01.1751 (OS) / 12.01.1752 (NS), sisters’ house Pudsey 1752, sacrament Yorkshire in Fulneck 02.12.1753, sisters’ house Fulneck 09.11.1754, founder member Fulneck congregation 19.04.1755 family: daughter of William Clark d 11.10.1756 aged 29 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br G Traneker 14.10.1756 grave 103 - 1st section, 3rd row, 8th grave from path

(W/P/G/F)>=#CRAVEN, Sarah (1723-1790) b 01.12.1723 Rothwell occupation: spinner reception: baptized Church of England, Ingham’s society Rothwell, received society Holbeck 1745, sisters’ house Gomersal 20.05.1755, received congregation Gomersal in Fulneck 04.03.1756, sisters’ house Fulneck 20.09.1756, sacrament Fulneck 21.03.1757 d 10.11.1790 aged 66 Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br G Traneker 15.11.1790 grave 869 - 1st section, 51st row, 1st grave by path

event.desc: Fulneck Babtized by Br J Worthington

person.note: F)LILEY, Susanna (1769-1846) b 22.09.1769 Fulneck resided: Knotting 1794, Riseley 1799-1813, Baildon 1819, Keighley 1820s, Sandy Wood House Keighley 1841 reception: baptized Fulneck by Br J Worthington 24.09.1769, received congregation Fulneck 01.12.1783, sacrament Fulneck 04.05.1785, transferred congregation Bedford, transferred congregation Fulneck 1813 m John SHARMAN (b 1767) St Peter’s Church Bedford 29.04.1794 - widowed 20.06.1837 family: daughter of James Liley (b 1727) and Ann (née Crowther) (b 1739), granddaughter of Robert Liley (b 1697) and Mary (née Walker) (b 1696), and Joshua Crowther (clothier) and Ann (née Procter) (b 1697), great-granddaughter of James Liley, and James Walker and Susannah (née Walker), and John Procter, niece of Joseph (b 1722), Rebecca (b 1724), Dinah (Saxon) (b 1728), Joshua (b 1730) and Mary Crowther (b 1743), cousin of Mary (b 1767), Ann (b 1769) and Sarah Saxon (b 1772), and Joshua (b 1760), Elizabeth (b 1762), Ann (b 1765) and Mary Crowther (b 1768), sister of James (b 1773), sister-in-law of Eleanor Cockill (b 1780), and Ann Mary Sharman (b 1752), Eleonora (Schirmer) (b 1759) and Sarah (Church) (b 1760), aunt of James (b 1809), Sarah Ann (Warren) (b 1810), Ellinor (b 1812), Lydia Liley (b 1813), Charlotte (England) (b 1816) and Mary Susanna (Clemens) (b 1821), daughter-in-law of John Sharman (b 1727) and Modesty (née Yonness) (b 1729), mother of Elizabeth (b 1795), Charlotte (b 1796), Sophia (b 1797), Charles James (b 1799), Ann (Archer) (b 1802), John Henry (b 1803), George (b 1806), Samuel Renatus (b 1808), Sarah (b 1810) and Margaret Susanna (Craig) (b 1813), mother-in-law of William Archer (b 1801), Sarah Hannah (née Maud) (b 1807), Mary Harland (née Chippendale) (b 1807), Phoebe (née Pilling) (b 1800) and William Craig (b 1808), grandmother of Joseph Charles (b 1834), Mary Susanna (Morrow) (b 1836) and John William Archer (b 1839), and James Maud (b 1827), John (b 1830), Martha (Archer) (b 1832), William (b 1834) and Charlotte Ann Sharman (b 1836), and Elizabeth Susanna (b 1832), Sarah Ann (Liversedge) (b 1833), Henry Harland (b 1835), Charles John (b 1837), Martha (Sharman) (b 1839), Mary (Robinson) (b 1839), George Renatus (b 1842) and Frederick Chippendale Sharman (b 1845), and Frederic William (b 1838), Emma Elizabeth (b 1840), Margaret Louisa (b 1842), John Henry (b 1843) and Charles William Craig (b 1846), and great-grandmother of George William (b 1861), Charles Herbert (b 1864), Frank Sharman (b 1871) and Walter James Archer (b 1875), and George Henry (b 1864), Mary Ellen (b 1868), Alice Ann (b 1870), William N (b 1872), Charles J (b 1874) and Elizabeth S Archer (b 1875), and William Maud (b 1851), Hannah (b 1852), Mary Jane (b 1856), George (b 1858), Beecroft (b 1859), Christiana (b 1861), Charlotte (b 1864), Alice (b 1866) and Charles James Sharman (b 1868), and John Earl (b 1868), Christopher George (b 1870), Charles James (b 1872) and Catherine Sharman (b 1873), and Florence (b 1859), Agnes Ann (Langford) (b 1863), Jacob William (b 1864), Henry Sharman (b 1865), Mary Louisa (b 1867) and Samuel Harland Liversedge (b 1869), and Samuel William (b 1871), George Henry (b 1874), Charles John (b 1876), Ernest H (b 1879), Alfred (b 1881), Florence (b 1883), Edward (b 1887) and Martha E Sharman (b 1889) d 04.07.1846 aged 76 Keighley, interred Fulneck by Br J Rogers 08.07.1846 grave 1711 - 2nd section, 39th row, 8th grave from path together with father James Liley (grave 1121)

event.desc: recieved society Cleckheaton when a boy
28 May, 1748 8 April, 1748 recieved congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck

person.note:
(LW/G/F)CBsb=#LILEY, James (1727-1802) b 04.01.1726 (OS) / 15.01.1727 (NS) Hightown Parish of Birstall occupation: clothier resided: Fulneck 21.11.1768 reception: baptized St Peter’s Church Birstall 22.01.1726 (OS) / 02.02.1726 (NS), added Ingham’s society Cleckheaton, received society Cleckheaton when a boy 1743, transferred society Little Gomersal 1748, received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 28.05.1748 (OS) / 08.06.1748 (NS) , brethren’s house Wyke 28. 06.1748 (OS) / 09.07.1748 (NS), confirmed Yorkshire in Fulneck 02.08.1748 (OS) / 13.08.1748 (NS), sacrament Yorkshire in Fulneck 02.11.1748 (OS) / 13.11.1748 (NS), brethren’s house Fulneck 25.04.1752 - 21.11.1768, founder member Fulneck congregation 19.04.1755, regulated Fulneck 12.11.1759 congregation office: College of Overseers church orders: received as acoluth Fulneck 14.08.1766 church service: single brethren’s choir helper Fulneck, curator of single sisters Fulneck m Ann Crowther (b 1739) St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley 21.11.1768 family: son of Robert Liley (b 1697) and Mary (née Walker) (b 1696), grandson of James Liley, and James Walker and Susannah (née Walker), nephew of Mary Liley (b 1709), son-in-law of Joshua Crowther (clothier) and Ann (née Procter) (b 1697), brother-in-law of Joseph (b 1722), Rebecca (b 1724), Dinah (Saxon) (b 1728), Joshua (b 1730) and Mary Crowther (b 1743), father of Susanna (Sharman) (b 1769) and James (b 1773), father-in-law of John Sharman (b 1767) and Ellinor (née Cockill) (b 1780), grandfather of Elizabeth (b 1795), Charlotte (b 1796), Sophia (b 1797), Charles James (b 1799), Ann (Archer) (b 1802), John Henry (b 1803), George (b 1806), Samuel Renatus (b 1808), Sarah Sharman (b 1810) and Margaret Susanna (Craig) (b 1813), and James (b 1809), Sarah Ann (Warren) (b 1810), Ellinor (b 1812), Lydia Liley (b 1813), Charlotte (England) (b 1816) and Mary Susanna (Clemens) (b 1821), great-grandfather Joseph Charles (b 1834), Mary Susanna (Morrow) (b 1836) and John William Archer (b 1839), and James Maud (b 1827), John (b 1830), Martha (Archer) (b 1832), William (b 1834) and Charlotte Ann Sharman (b 1836), and Elizabeth Susanna (b 1832), Sarah Ann (Liversedge) (b 1833), Henry Harland (b 1835), Charles John (b 1837), Martha (Sharman) (b 1839), Mary (Robinson) (b 1839), George Renatus (b 1842) and Frederick Chippendale Sharman (b 1845), and Frederic William (b 1838), Emma Elizabeth (b 1840), Margaret Louisa (b 1842), John Henry (b 1843) and Charles William Craig (b 1846), and William Hunt Liley (b 1837), Charlotte Susannah (Senior) (b 1839), Mary Ellinor (Bailey) (b 1842), Sarah Ann (Wilson) (b 1844) and Lydia Cockill (Birtill) (b 1846), and Phoebe Ellinor (b 1837), Charlotte (Skeen) (b 1839), Arthur (b 1841), James Liley (b 1843), Samuel (b 1845), Isaac (b 1846), John Henry (b 1848), Thomas Stephen (b 1850), Frederick William (b 1852) and Godfrey Octavius Warren (b 1854), and John J Liley (b 1843), Charlotte Ann (MacCabe) (b 1844), Richard (b 1845), Lydia (b 1848), Ellinor (b 1850), Sarah Ann (b 1851), Thomas Cockill (b 1853), Clifford (b 1855), Luke Lawrence (b 1856), Caroline England (b 1858) and Adelaide Victoria (Arnold) (b 1861), and Lydia Helena (Swire) (b 1851), Frederic (b 1852), Mary Ellinor (Hahn) (b 1854), Amelia Louisa (Mumford) (b 1855), Godfrey (b 1857), Theodor Liley (b 1858), Annie (b 1860), Emily (b 1862) and Charlotte Elizabeth Clemens (b 1864), great-great-grandfather of George William (b 1861), Charles Herbert (b 1864), Frank Sharman (b 1871) and Walter James Archer (b 1875), and George Henry (b 1864), Mary Ellen (b 1868), Alice Ann (b 1870), William N (b 1872), Charles J (b 1874) and Elizabeth S Archer (b 1875), and William Maud (b 1851), Hannah (b 1852), Mary Jane (b 1856), George (b 1858), Beecroft (b 1859), Christiana (b 1861), Charlotte (b 1864), Alice (b 1866) and Charles James Sharman (b 1868), and John Earl (b 1868), Christopher George (b 1870), Charles James (b 1872) and
Catherine Sharman (b 1873), and Florence (b 1859), Agnes Ann (Langford) (b 1863), Jacob William (b 1864), Henry Sharman (b 1865), Mary Louisa (b 1867) and Samuel Harland Liversedge (b 1869), and Samuel William (b 1871), George Henry (b 1874), Charles John (b 1876), Ernest H (b 1879), Alfred (b 1881), Florence (b 1883), Edward (b 1887) and Martha E Sharman (b 1889), and Mary Elizabeth (Hawkes) (b 1875), Edith Eleanor (b 1878) and Henry Liley Senior (b 1882), and Mary Elizabeth (Wareing) (b 1869), Winifred Ellen (b 1871), William Liley (b 1874), John Herbert (b 1876), Ronald Cathcart (b 1878), Harold James (b 1880) and Gilbert Moore Wilson (b 1884), and Alexander William (b 1873), Caroline Mary (b 1874), Charlotte Mary (b 1874), Henry Edward (b 1876), Charles Ernest (b 1878) and John Gerald Birtill (b 1886), and Ellinor A E MacCabe (b 1874), and Robert and Frederick Skeen, and Olive (b 1884), Norman (b 1889) and Conway Arnold (b 1892), and James Reginald (b 1888), Geoffrey Samuel (b 1889), Marjorie (b 1891) and Mary Isabella Swire (b 1894), and Godfrey Jackson (b 1878), Warren Jackson (b 1880), Helena (b 1883) and Frederick Broadbent Clemens (b 1884), and Frederic Warren Theodor (b 1889), Mary Liley (b 1891) and Anna E Clemens (b 1893), great-great-great-grandfather of Eric Avon Hawkes (b 1908), and Annie Elizabeth Wilson (b 1905), and Peggy Wilson, and Mary (Smith) (b 1905) and Edward Wilson (b 1909), and Charles Henry J (b 1899), Francis Ernest (b 1901), Mabel Lydia (b 1903), Irene Maud (b 1904) and Hilda Violet Birtill (b 1910), and Henry Roy Birtill (b 1905), and Frank Theodor Clemens (b 1912), great-great-great-great-grandfather of Rosemary Smith, and Patrick (b 1934), Edward James (b 1936) and Michael Ralph Wilson (b 1943) d 10.07.1802 aged 75 Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br S T Benade 14.07.1802 grave 1121 - 2nd section, 39th row, 8th grave from path together with daughter Susanna Sharman (grave 1711) (F/G)LILEY, James (1773-1827) b 02.07.1773 Fulneck occupation: clothier reception: baptized Fulneck by Br E Miller 04.07.1773, received congregation Fulneck 09.04.1787, sacrament Fulneck 28.06.1794 church orders: ordained as deacon November 1807 church service: teacher and room overseer boys’ school Fulneck December 1801, assistant and single brethren’s labourer Dublin 27.05.1805, congregation labourer Gracehill 20.11.1807 and co-director boys’ academy 09.10.1811, co-labourer and co-director boys’ academy Gracehill 1813, director boys’ academy Fairfield March 1820, congregation labourer Gomersal 1823, Bedford with Culworth 1824-26 provincial office: provincial helper Bedford 1824, Ockbrook 1826, retired widows’ house Fulneck November 1826 m Ellinor Cockill (b 1780) St Peter’s Church Birstall 22.10.1807 family: son of James Liley (b 1727) and Ann (née Crowther) (b 1739), grandson of Robert Liley (b 1697) and Mary (née Walker) (b 1696), and Joshua Crowther (clothier) and Ann (née Procter) (b 1697), great-grandson of James Liley, and James Walker and Susannah (née Walker), and John Procter, nephew of Joseph (b 1722), Rebecca (b 1724), Dinah (Saxon) (b 1728), Joshua (b 1730) and Mary Crowther (b 1743), cousin of Mary (b 1767), Ann (b 1769) and Sarah Saxon (b 1772), and Joshua (b 1760), Elizabeth (b 1762), Ann (b 1765) and Mary Crowther (b 1768), brother of Susanna (Sharman) (b 1769), brother-in-law of John Sharman (b 1767), and Thomas (b 1774), Mary (Waller) (b 1776), Lydia Cockill (b 1777) and Sarah (Waller) (b 1785),
uncle of Elizabeth (b 1795), Charlotte (b 1796), Sophia (b 1797), Charles James (b 1799), Ann (Archer) (b 1802), John Henry (b 1803), George (b 1806), Samuel Renatus (b 1808), Sarah Sharman (b 1810) and Margaret Susanna (Craig) (b 1813), son-in-law of Thomas Cockill (b 1748) and Sarah (née Wilcock) (b 1748), father of James (b 1809), Sarah Ann (Warren) (b 1810), Ellinor (b 1812), Lydia (b 1813), Charlotte (England) (b 1816) and Mary Susanna (Clemens) (b 1821), father-in-law of Susanna (née Sharp) (b 1804), Samuel Warren (b 1808), James England (b 1810) and Godfrey Clemens (b 1818), grandfather of William Hunt Liley (b 1837), Charlotte Susannah (Senior) (b 1839), Mary Ellinor (Bailey) (b 1842), Sarah Ann (Wilson) (b 1844) and Lydia Cockill (Birtill) (b 1846), and Phoebe Ellinor (b 1837), Charlotte (Skeen) (b 1839), Arthur (b 1841), James Liley (b 1843), Samuel (b 1845), Isaac (b 1846), John Henry (b 1848), Thomas Stephen (b 1850), Frederick William (b 1852) and Godfrey Octavius Warren (b 1854), and John J Liley (b 1843), Charlotte Ann (MacCabe) (b 1844), Richard (b 1845), Lydia (b 1848), Ellinor (b 1850), Sarah Ann (b 1851), Thomas Cockill (b 1853), Clifford (b
